clinical_study.brief_title: DIAMANTE - Diseases Infectious Analysis Microflora Antibiotic Effect
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Effects of Enterogermina, 2 Billion Bacillus Clausii Spores, on the Intestinal Flora of Children Antibiotic Treated for Bacterial Upper Respiratory Tract Infections: Open, Pilot Study.

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the effects of Bacillus clausii (Enterogermina®) on fecal microbial flora (using Polymerase Chain Reaction - Denaturing Gradient Gel Electrophoresis - PCR-DGGE - Method) in antibiotic-treated children with complicated acute otitis media or beta-hemolytic streptococcal pharyngo-tonsillitis.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes of microbial composition of fecal bacterial flora by PCR-DGGE analysis.
primary_outcome.time_frame: between samples obtained at baseline and follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline of body weight
Presence of Bacillus clausii spores in feces
secondary_outcome.time_frame: after heat shock treatment on selective medium.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number and rate of patients with GI symptoms and time to first development of symptoms.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: recorded in a daily diary card for the total study period

arm_group.description: Enterogermina® vials containing 2×109 spores of polyantibiotic resistant Bacillus clausii (test drug)

intervention.description: 2 Enterogermina vials/day for 12 to 17 days (i.e. during the 5 to 10-days antibiotic treatment and for 7 days thereafter.
